alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 4:22PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Very Hot Weekend Over The Eastern Interior... ...High Water On The Tanana River Into Next Week... The Eastern Interior will become warmer and drier over the weekend with isolated afternoon thunderstorms. Temperatures will rise into the 80s over most of the Eastern Interior on Saturday, and into the 80s and low 90s on Sunday and Monday. Fairbanks is expected to reach 90 on Sunday and Monday. Similar hot and dry conditions with isolated afternoon thunderstorms will likely continue over the Eastern Interior into the middle of next week. There will likely be a return of smoke from Canadian wild fires over the Eastern Interior this weekend. People should take precautions for heat this weekend. The Tanana River is near bankfull, and will remain very high into next week. This high water is due to rising freezing levels adding high elevation snow and glacial melt this weekend into next week. Other glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Delta and Nenana Rivers will also remain very high into next week. Most gravel bars on the Tanana River will be covered by water, and some normally dry sloughs and other low lying areas will fill with water. Low areas around boat launches could see water in them. These glacial rivers will contain an increased numbers of logs and trees floating down them through next week and boaters should use caution.
